conclusion: Analyze forces using equilibrium and friction principles
Body C is placed between A and B, all bodies are hemispherical
Identify forces on body C: weight, normal forces from A and B
Identify forces on body A: weight, normal forces from C and B, frictional force, normal force from ground
Identify forces on body B: weight, normal forces from C and A, frictional force, normal force from ground
For body C, net vertical force is zero: N_AC + N_BC = mg
For body C, net horizontal force is zero: N_AC = N_BC
N_AC = N_BC = mg/2
For body A, net vertical force is zero: N_CA + F = mg
For body A, net horizontal force is zero: N_CA = f_A
N_CA = f_A
F = mg - N_CA
For body B, net vertical force is zero: N_CB + F = 2mg
For body B, net horizontal force is zero: N_CB = f_B
N_CB = f_B
F = 2mg - N_CB
Relate normal forces to frictional forces for bodies A and B
Maximum static frictional force: f_max = mu * F
f_A = sqrt(3)/6 * F
f_B = sqrt(3)/6 * F
Solve for normal force F using equilibrium condition for A
F(sqrt(3)/6 + 1) = mg
Simplify denominator and solve for F
